label: Neutrino Mass Splittings Δm²
mathematical_goal: Derive neutrino mass-squared differences Δm²₂₁ ≈ 7.4×10⁻⁵ eV² (solar) and Δm²₃₁ ≈ 2.5×10⁻³ eV² (atmospheric) from G₂ topology via type-I seesaw mechanism
theoretical_significance: Neutrino masses arise from type-I seesaw: m_ν ~ (y_ν v)²/M_R, where M_R ~ M_GUT/k_gimel ~ 10¹⁵ GeV is the right-handed neutrino mass scale set by G₂ moduli. The atmospheric splitting Δm²₃₁ is controlled by the ratio b₃/χ_eff = 24/144 = 1/6, representing the fraction of 3-form flux available for neutrino masses. The solar splitting Δm²₂₁ is suppressed by (b₂/b₃)² = (14/24)² ≈ 0.34 relative to atmospheric, arising from 2-cycle vs 3-cycle topology. PM predicts Δm²₃₁ ~ 2.4×10⁻³ eV² and Δm²₂₁ ~ 8×10⁻⁵ eV², in good agreement with oscillation data (Super-K, SNO, KamLAND). The ratio Δm²₂₁/Δm²₃₁ ≈ 0.034 is a pure geometric prediction: (b₂/b₃)² ≈ 0.34.

derivation_chain: Type-I seesaw: m_ν = m_D² / M_R with m_D = y_ν v
Solar: Δm²₂₁ ~ Δm²₃₁ · (14/24)² ≈ 8.2×10⁻⁵ eV² (vs. 7.41×10⁻⁵ eV² observed)
